intro: Uapaca mangorensis, commonly known as the mangorensis kola nut, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits containing one to three seeds. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their potential health benefits.
